data.text: @WgtnCC How many people caught covid from the vaccine and died? How many? Funny how the spike in infections around the world go up on every vaccine roll out.... https://t.co/9L8e7n6JiO
@GwennRJ Kia ora, residents who cannot stockpile or travel to the Recycle Station may choose to put their glass in their rubbish. We are hoping the drivers have a speedy recovery. Ngā mihi ^Simone
@WgtnCC So .. what will we do with our recycling and glasses .. no room to store them and no car to go to transfer station…
@GwennRJ Please note that rubbish and recycling collections are not funded by rates. Our contractors are working hard to employ more drivers to increase capacity. Ngā mihi ^Simone

@GwennRJ Mōrena, this is a different scenario from the 2020 lockdown. Unfortunately there is already a nationwide driver shortage and now several drivers are sick. Collecting rubbish is the priority for the remaining staff as it’s a health and safety risk to leave it on the streets.
@nickacelvn @WgtnCC Thank you for asking.. I was going to ask to.
@WgtnCC 😡😡😡 such a lack of planning from WCC ..you have 2 years to devise plan B in these types of situation!!! We are paying enough rates !!!
@WgtnCC We already put our glasses when seeing this announce per chance. .. all my street did and it was not collected. We cannot stockpile.
@WgtnCC Use Indian vaccines like Covishield or covaxin to counter Covid effectively,Pfizer vaccine is not that effective. Ask your Govt to analyse the real time data and import accordingly.
@Huttvalleycraz1 @WgtnCC @caffeine_addict Ha Watta bitch! Looking great in the mask brah
